alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Dutchess; Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 2:35PM EDT until July 27 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of western Massachusetts and east central New York, including the following counties, in western Massachusetts, Berkshire. In east central New York, Columbia, Dutchess, Greene and Ulster. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 234 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area with high rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pittsfield, Great Barrington, Hudson, Catskill, Saugerties, Claverack, Lee, Woodstock, Lenox, Livingston, Copake, Clermont, Red Hook, Becket, Athens, Austerlitz, Philmont, Claverack-Red Mills, Lorenz Park and Housatonic. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
